meanings.definition: The act of forming a lip or lips.
meanings.sent1: She admired the delicate lipping of the vase's rim.
meanings.sent2: The baby's lipping was so cute when she puckered up for a kiss.
meanings.sent3: The artist's lipping of the clay created a unique shape for the sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The gentle lipping of the waves against the shore was calming.
meanings.sent5: His lipping of the envelope showed his attention to detail in sealing it.

meanings.definition: The act of touching with the lips.
meanings.sent1: Their lipping in the movie was so romantic.
meanings.sent2: A mother's lipping on her child's forehead is a gesture of love.
meanings.sent3: The cat's lipping of the fish was a playful attempt to catch it.
meanings.sent4: The lipping of the cup's edge left a lipstick mark.
meanings.sent5: The lipping of the birthday cake candle was a sweet tradition.

meanings.definition: The act of covering or lining with a thin layer.
meanings.sent1: The lipping of chocolate on the strawberries made them irresistible.
meanings.sent2: The lipping of frost on the window created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent3: The lipping of dust on the bookshelf showed it needed cleaning.
meanings.sent4: The lipping of paint on the canvas added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The lipping of snow on the branches made the tree look magical.
